bullet.description: A single bullet point to display. Use this for simple lists of items like skills, technologies, or brief statements.
bullet.title: Bullet

email.description: Accepts either a single email address (string) or a list of email addresses.
email.title: Email

photo.description: Path to the photo file, relative to the input YAML file.

phone.description: Phone number with country code. Use international format starting with '+' (e.g., +1 for USA, +44 for UK). Accepts either a single phone number as a string or a list of phone numbers.
phone.title: Phone

website.description: Personal website or portfolio URL. Accepts either a single website URL as as a list.
website.title: Website

social_networks.description: List of social network profiles (e.g., LinkedIn, GitHub).
social_networks.title: Social Networks

sections.description: The sections of your CV (e.g., Experience, Education, Projects). The keys are section titles, and the values are lists of entries. Entries are automatically typed based on their fields.
sections.title: Sections

language.description: The language of the locale. The default value is 'english'.
language.title: Language

last_updated.description: Translation of "Last updated in" in the locale. The default value is "Last updated in".
last_updated.title: Last Updated

month.description: Translation of the word "month" in the locale.
month.title: Month

months.description: Translation of the word "months" in the locale.
months.title: Months

year.description: Translation of the word "year" in the locale.
year.title: Year

years.description: Translation of the word "years" in the locale.
years.title: Years

present.description: Translation of the word "present" in the locale.
present.title: Present

month_abbreviations.description: Abbreviations of the months in the locale.
month_abbreviations.title: Month Abbreviations

month_names.description: Full names of the months in the locale.
month_names.title: Month Names

month_abbreviations.title: Month Abbreviations

month_names.description: Full names of the months in the locale.
month_names.title: Month Names

number.description: The numbered item text. Use this for ordered lists where you want numbering (e.g., publications, patents).
number.title: Number

size.description: The page size of your CV. Common options: 'a4' (international standard), 'us-letter' (US standard). The default value is `us-letter`.
size.title: Size

top_margin.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `2cm`.

bottom_margin.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `2cm`.

left_margin.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `2cm`.

right_margin.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `2cm`.

show_footer.description: Whether to show the footer. The default value is `true`.
show_footer.title: Show Footer

show_top_note.description: Whether to show the top note. The default value is `true`.
show_top_note.title: Show Top Note

design.description: The file path to the YAML file that contains the `design` field.

locale.description: The file path to the YAML file that contains the `locale` field.

typst_path.description:
Path to the output Typst file, relative to the input YAML file. The default value is `rendercv_output/NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE_CV.typ`.

 `rendercv_output/NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE_CV.typ`.

The following placeholders can be used:

- MONTH_NAME: Full name of the month (e.g., January)
- MONTH_ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation of the month (e.g., Jan)
- MONTH: Month as a number (e.g., 1)
- MONTH_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Month as a number in two digits (e.g., 01)
- YEAR: Year as a number (e.g., 2024)
- YEAR_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Year as a number in two digits (e.g., 24)
- NAME: The name of the CV owner (e.g., John Doe)
- NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in snake case (e.g., John_Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower snake case (e.g., john_doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper snake case (e.g., JOHN_DOE)
- NAME_IN_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in kebab case (e.g., John-Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower kebab case (e.g., john-doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper kebab case (e.g., JOHN-DOE)

pdf_path.description:
Path to the output PDF file, relative to the input YAML file. The default value is `rendercv_output/NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE_CV.pdf`.

The following placeholders can be used:

- MONTH_NAME: Full name of the month (e.g., January)
- MONTH_ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation of the month (e.g., Jan)
- MONTH: Month as a number (e.g., 1)
- MONTH_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Month as a number in two digits (e.g., 01)
- YEAR: Year as a number (e.g., 2024)
- YEAR_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Year as a number in two digits (e.g., 24)
- NAME: The name of the CV owner (e.g., John Doe)
- NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in snake case (e.g., John_Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower snake case (e.g., john_doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper snake case (e.g., JOHN_DOE)
- NAME_IN_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in kebab case (e.g., John-Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower kebab case (e.g., john-doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper kebab case (e.g., JOHN-DOE)

markdown_path.description:
Path to the output Markdown file, relative to the input YAML file. The default value is `rendercv_output/NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE_CV.md`.

The following placeholders can be used:

- MONTH_NAME: Full name of the month (e.g., January)
- MONTH_ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation of the month (e.g., Jan)
- MONTH: Month as a number (e.g., 1)
- MONTH_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Month as a number in two digits (e.g., 01)
- YEAR: Year as a number (e.g., 2024)
- YEAR_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Year as a number in two digits (e.g., 24)
- NAME: The name of the CV owner (e.g., John Doe)
- NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in snake case (e.g., John_Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower snake case (e.g., john_doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper snake case (e.g., JOHN_DOE)
- NAME_IN_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in kebab case (e.g., John-Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower kebab case (e.g., john-doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper kebab case (e.g., JOHN-DOE)
markdown_path.title: Markdown Path

html_path.description:
Path to the output HTML file, relative to the input YAML file. The default value is `rendercv_output/NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE_CV.html`.

The following placeholders can be used:

- MONTH_NAME: Full name of the month (e.g., January)
- MONTH_ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation of the month (e.g., Jan)
- MONTH: Month as a number (e.g., 1)
- MONTH_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Month as a number in two digits (e.g., 01)
- YEAR: Year as a number (e.g., 2024)
- YEAR_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Year as a number in two digits (e.g., 24)
- NAME: The name of the CV owner (e.g., John Doe)
- NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in snake case (e.g., John_Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower snake case (e.g., john_doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper snake case (e.g., JOHN_DOE)
- NAME_IN_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in kebab case (e.g., John-Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower kebab case (e.g., john-doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper kebab case (e.g., JOHN-DOE)

png_path.description:
Path to the output PNG file, relative to the input YAML file. The default value is `rendercv_output/NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE_CV.png`.

The following placeholders can be used:

- MONTH_NAME: Full name of the month (e.g., January)
- MONTH_ABBREVIATION: Abbreviation of the month (e.g., Jan)
- MONTH: Month as a number (e.g., 1)
- MONTH_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Month as a number in two digits (e.g., 01)
- YEAR: Year as a number (e.g., 2024)
- YEAR_IN_TWO_DIGITS: Year as a number in two digits (e.g., 24)
- NAME: The name of the CV owner (e.g., John Doe)
- NAME_IN_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in snake case (e.g., John_Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower snake case (e.g., john_doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_SNAKE_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper snake case (e.g., JOHN_DOE)
- NAME_IN_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in kebab case (e.g., John-Doe)
- NAME_IN_LOWER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in lower kebab case (e.g., john-doe)
- NAME_IN_UPPER_KEBAB_CASE: The name of the CV owner in upper kebab case (e.g., JOHN-DOE)

dont_generate_markdown.description: If `True`, the Markdown file will not be generated. Disabling Markdown generation implicitly disables HTML. The default value is `False`.
dont_generate_markdown.title: Don't Generate Markdown

dont_generate_html.description: If `True`, the HTML file will not be generated. The default value is `False`.
dont_generate_html.title: Don't Generate HTML

dont_generate_typst.description: If `True`, the Typst file will not be generated. Disabling Typst generation implicitly disables PDF and PNG. The default value is `False`.
dont_generate_typst.title: Don't Generate Typst

dont_generate_pdf.description: If `True`, the PDF file will not be generated. The default value is `False`.
dont_generate_pdf.title: Don't Generate PDF

dont_generate_png.description: If `True`, the PNG file will not be generated. The default value is `False`.
dont_generate_png.title: Don't Generate PNG

reversed_number.description: The text for a reverse-numbered list item. The numbering will be in reverse order (e.g., 5, 4, 3, 2, 1), useful for publications where you want the most recent items to have higher numbers.
reversed_number.title: Reversed Number

current_date.description: The date RenderCV should treat as "today."It is used for output filenames, the "last updated" label, and any calculations that depend on the current date (such as ongoing time spans). Defaults to the real current date.
current_date.title: Date

render_command.description: RenderCV's `render` command settings. They are the same as the command line arguments. CLI arguments have higher priority than the settings in the input file.
render_command.title: Render Command Settings

bold_keywords.description: The keywords that will be bold in the output. The default value is an empty list.
bold_keywords.title: Bold Keywords

name.description: Whether to use small caps for the name. The default value is `false`.
name.title: Name

headline.description: Whether to use small caps for the headline. The default value is `false`.
headline.title: Headline

connections.description: Whether to use small caps for connections. The default value is `false`.
connections.title: Connections

section_titles.description: Whether to use small caps for section titles. The default value is `false`.
section_titles.title: Section Titles

network.description: The name of the social network or platform.

space_above.description: Space above the summary text. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0cm`.

space_left.description: Left margin for the summary text (appears before highlights). It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0cm`.

language.description: The language of the locale. The default value is 'english'.
language.title: Language

last_updated.description: Translation of "Last updated in" in the locale. The default value is "Last updated in".
last_updated.title: Last Updated

month.description: Translation of the word "month" in the locale.
month.title: Month

months.description: Translation of the word "months" in the locale.
months.title: Months

year.description: Translation of the word "year" in the locale.
year.title: Year

years.description: Translation of the word "years" in the locale.
years.title: Years

present.description: Translation of the word "present" in the locale.
present.title: Present

month_abbreviations.description: Abbreviations of the months in the locale.
month_abbreviations.title: Month Abbreviations

month_names.description: Full names of the months in the locale.
month_names.title: Month Names

date.description: The date of this event. Can be in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY format, or any custom text like 'Fall 2023' or 'Summer 2020'. Use this for single-day or imprecise dates. For events with a duration, use `start_date` and `end_date` instead.

start_date.description: The start date. Can be written in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY format.

end_date.description: The end date. Can be written in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY format. Use "present" for ongoing events, or simply omit `end_date` to automatically indicate the event is ongoing.
end_date.title: End Date

examples: Led a team of 5 engineers to develop innovative solutions.
Completed advanced coursework in machine learning and artificial intelligence.
summary.title: Summary

highlights.description: A list of bullet points highlighting your key achievements, responsibilities, or contributions.
examples: Increased system performance by 40% through optimization.
Mentored 3 junior developers and conducted code reviews.
Implemented CI/CD pipeline reducing deployment time by 60%.
highlights.title: Highlights

institution.description: The name of the educational institution.
institution.title: Institution

degree.description: Degree type (e.g., BS, MS, PhD). Leave empty if not applicable.
degree.title: Degree

end_date.description: The end date. Can be written in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY format. Use "present" for ongoing events, or simply omit `end_date` to automatically indicate the event is ongoing.

name.description: The name of the entry, such as `Some Project`, `Some Event`, etc.
name.title: Name

label.description: The label/heading for this item (e.g., a category or field name).
label.title: Label

date.description: The date of this event. Can be in YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM, or YYYY format, or any custom text like 'Fall 2023' or 'Summer 2020'. Use this for single-day or imprecise dates. For events with a duration, use `start_date` and `end_date` instead.

authors.description: List of authors. A name can be bolded by wrapping it with **double asterisks**.
authors.title: Authors

doi.description: The DOI (Digital Object Identifier) of the publication. If provided, it will be used as the link instead of the URL.
doi.title: Doi

url.description: A URL link to the publication. Note: If DOI is provided, this URL will be ignored.
url.title: Url

journal.description: The name of the journal, conference, or venue where it was published.
journal.title: Journal

phone_number_format.description: The format for phone numbers. The default value is `national`.
phone_number_format.title: Phone Number Format

hyperlink.description: Whether to make contact information clickable links in the PDF. The default value is `true`.
hyperlink.title: Hyperlink

show_icons.description: Whether to show icons (phone, email, etc.) next to contact information. The default value is `true`.
show_icons.title: Show Icons

display_urls_instead_of_usernames.description: Whether to display full URLs instead of labels for connections. The default value is `false`.
display_urls_instead_of_usernames.title: Display Urls Instead Of Usernames

separator.description: Character(s) to separate contact items (e.g., '|' or '•'). Leave empty for no separator. The default value is `''`.
separator.title: Separator

space_between_connections.description: Horizontal space between each contact info item (email, phone, etc.). It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

phone_number_format.description: The format for phone numbers. The default value is `national`.
phone_number_format.title: Phone Number Format

hyperlink.description: Whether to make contact information clickable links in the PDF. The default value is `true`.
hyperlink.title: Hyperlink

show_icons.description: Whether to show icons (phone, email, etc.) next to contact information. The default value is `true`.
show_icons.title: Show Icons

display_urls_instead_of_usernames.description: Whether to display full URLs instead of labels for connections. The default value is `false`.
display_urls_instead_of_usernames.title: Display Urls Instead Of Usernames

separator.description: Character(s) to separate contact items (e.g., '|' or '•'). Leave empty for no separator. The default value is `''`.
separator.title: Separator

space_between_connections.description: Horizontal space between each contact info item (email, phone, etc.). It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

main_column.description: The content of the template. The available placeholders are all the keys used in the entries in uppercase. For example, **TITLE**. The default value is `**INSTITUTION**, AREA\nSUMMARY\nHIGHLIGHTS`.
main_column.title: Main Column

degree_column.description: If given, a degree column will be added to the education entry. If "null", no degree column will be shown. The available placeholders are all the keys used in the entries (in uppercase). The default value is `**DEGREE**`.
degree_column.title: Degree Column

date_and_location_column.description: The content of the template. The available placeholders are all the keys used in the entries in uppercase. For example, **TITLE**. The default value is `LOCATION\nDATE`.
date_and_location_column.title: Date And Location Column

main_column.default:
**INSTITUTION**, DEGREE in AREA -- LOCATION
SUMMARY
HIGHLIGHTS

date_and_location_column.description: The content of the template. The available placeholders are all the keys used in the entries in uppercase. For example, **TITLE**. The default value is `LOCATION\nDATE`.
date_and_location_column.title: Date And Location Column

date_and_location_width.description: Width of the right column (for dates and locations). It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `4.15cm`.

side_space.description: Left and right margins for entry content. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.2cm`.

space_between_columns.description: Space between the main content column and the date/location column. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.1cm`.

allow_page_break.description: Whether to allow page breaks within individual entries. If false, each entry will move to a new page if it doesn't fit. The default value is `true`.
allow_page_break.title: Allow Page Break

short_second_row.description: If true, the second row of entries will be shortened to align with the top of the date/location column. The default value is `false`.
short_second_row.title: Short Second Row

alignment.description: Alignment of header content (left, center, or right). The default value is `center`.

photo_width.description: The width of your photo in the header. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `3.5cm`.

space_below_name.description: Space below your name. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.7cm`.

space_below_headline.description: Space below the headline. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.7cm`.

bullet.description: The bullet character for highlights (your key achievements/responsibilities). The default value is `•`.

nested_bullet.description: The bullet character for nested (sub-level) highlights. The default value is `-`.

space_left.description: Left indentation for highlights. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.4cm`.

space_above.description: Space above the highlights section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.25cm`.

space_between_items.description: Vertical space between each highlight bullet point. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.25cm`.

space_between_bullet_and_text.description: Space between the bullet point and the highlight text. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5em`.

type.description: The visual style of section titles. 'with_partial_line' shows a line next to the title, 'with_full_line' extends the line across the page, 'without_line' shows no line, 'moderncv' uses the ModernCV style. The default value is `with_partial_line`.
type.title: Type

line_thickness.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5pt`.

space_above.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

space_below.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.3cm`.

type.description: The visual style of section titles. 'with_partial_line' shows a line next to the title, 'with_full_line' extends the line across the page, 'without_line' shows no line, 'moderncv' uses the ModernCV style. The default value is `with_full_line`.
type.title: Type

line_thickness.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5pt`.

space_above.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.55cm`.

space_below.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.2cm`.

type.description: The visual style of section titles. 'with_partial_line' shows a line next to the title, 'with_full_line' extends the line across the page, 'without_line' shows no line, 'moderncv' uses the ModernCV style. The default value is `moderncv`.
type.title: Type

line_thickness.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.15cm`.

space_above.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.55cm`.

space_below.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.3cm`.

type.description: The visual style of section titles. 'with_partial_line' shows a line next to the title, 'with_full_line' extends the line across the page, 'without_line' shows no line, 'moderncv' uses the ModernCV style. The default value is `with_full_line`.
type.title: Type

line_thickness.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5pt`.

space_above.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

space_below.description: It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.3cm`.

allow_page_break.description: Whether to allow page breaks within sections. If false, each section will start on a new page if it doesn't fit. The default value is `true`.
allow_page_break.title: Allow Page Break

space_between_regular_entries.description: Vertical space between separate entries in a section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `1.2em`.

space_between_text_entries.description: Vertical space between separate text entries in a section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

show_time_spans_in.description: List of section titles where time spans (duration) should be displayed in entries. For example, ['Experience', 'Education'] will show '2 years 3 months' for applicable entries. The default value is `[]`.
show_time_spans_in.title: Show Time Spans In

allow_page_break.description: Whether to allow page breaks within sections. If false, each section will start on a new page if it doesn't fit. The default value is `true`.
allow_page_break.title: Allow Page Break

space_between_regular_entries.description: Vertical space between separate entries in a section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.4cm`.

space_between_text_entries.description: Vertical space between separate text entries in a section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

show_time_spans_in.description: List of section titles where time spans (duration) should be displayed in entries. For example, ['Experience', 'Education'] will show '2 years 3 months' for applicable entries. The default value is `[]`.
show_time_spans_in.title: Show Time Spans In

allow_page_break.description: Whether to allow page breaks within sections. If false, each section will start on a new page if it doesn't fit. The default value is `true`.
allow_page_break.title: Allow Page Break

space_between_regular_entries.description: Vertical space between separate entries in a section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `1.2em`.

space_between_text_entries.description: Vertical space between separate text entries in a section. It can be specified with units (cm, in, pt, mm, ex, em). For example, `0.1cm`. The default value is `0.5cm`.

show_time_spans_in.description: List of section titles where time spans (duration) should be displayed in entries. For example, ['Experience', 'Education'] will show '2 years 3 months' for applicable entries. The default value is `[]`.
show_time_spans_in.title: Show Time Spans In

footer.description: Template for the footer. Available placeholders: NAME, PAGE_NUMBER, TOTAL_PAGES. The default value is `NAME - PAGE_NUMBER/TOTAL_PAGES`.
footer.title: Footer

top_note.description: Template for the top note. Available placeholders: LAST_UPDATED, CURRENT_DATE. The default value is `LAST_UPDATED CURRENT_DATE`.
top_note.title: Top Note

single_date.description: Template for single dates. Available placeholders: MONTH_ABBREVIATION, YEAR. The default value is `MONTH_ABBREVIATION YEAR`.
single_date.title: Single Date

date_range.description: Template for date ranges. Available placeholders: START_DATE, END_DATE. The default value is `START_DATE – END_DATE`.
date_range.title: Date Range

time_span.description: Template for time spans. Available placeholders: HOW_MANY_YEARS, YEARS, HOW_MANY_MONTHS, MONTHS. The default value is `HOW_MANY_YEARS YEARS HOW_MANY_MONTHS MONTHS`.
time_span.title: Time Span

line_spacing.description: The line spacing (space between lines of text). Larger values create more vertical space. The default value is `0.6em`.

alignment.description: How text is aligned. 'justified' spreads text across the full width, 'left' aligns to the left edge. The default value is `justified`.
alignment.title: Alignment

date_and_location_column_alignment.description: Alignment for the date and location column (the right column in entries). The default value is `right`.

font_family.description: Font family settings for different elements.

font_size.description: Font size settings for different elements.

small_caps.description: Small caps settings for different elements.

design.description: The design information of the CV. The default is the `classic` theme.
design.title: Design

locale.description: The locale catalog of the CV to allow the support of multiple languages.
locale.title: Locale Catalog

title: RenderCV
description: RenderCV allows you to version-control CVs/resumes as JSON or YAML files.
